resource.chars:
“In the course of these ex-
periments with the sun, I 
observed a remarkable source  
of fallacy with respect to the 
increase of the quantity of 
air confined by mercury 
when there is so much 
moisture in the inside as 
to be subject to sudden 
dilations and <s>contractions<\s> compressions 
For a considerable quantity 
of common air would get 
into the inside of the vessel 
when there was a depth of 
an inch of mercury on 
the outside of it, and of 
two or three inches within 
In these circumstances I 
have seen more than an 
ounce
